content:
Maybe slightly of topic but a quick question.
My friend tried to build from Git master on a Bullseye Rpi. It didn't succeeded this time.
Is Bullseye not supported any more? Something in my mind says so? I don't get the same errors on my Bookworm.

make errors:

-- Found Git: /usr/bin/git (found version "2.30.2")
CMake Error at /home/pi/Builds/OpenCPN/libs/libdnet/cmake/PatchFile.cmake:32 (cmake_path):
  Unknown CMake command "cmake_path".
 .........

make[2]: *** [libs/libdnet/CMakeFiles/_libdnet.dir/build.make:123: libs/libdnet/_libdnet-prefix/src/_libdnet-stamp/_libdnet-patch] Error 1
make[1]: *** [CMakeFiles/Makefile2:1451: libs/libdnet/CMakeFiles/_libdnet.dir/all] Error 2
make[1]: *** Inväntar oavslutade jobb... (>> ***Awaiting unfinished jobs***)

..........

CMakeFiles/SERIAL.dir/src/impl/list_ports/list_ports_linux.cc.o
/usr/bin/ranlib libSERIAL.a
[  8%] Built target SERIAL
make: *** [Makefile:174: all] Fail 2
A message was moved here from #OCPN 5.10 Release plan > Supported platforms by Alec Leamas.
cmake on bullseye is outdated. Look into ci/generic-build-debian.sh how we get a usable cmake version.
The scripts talks about Focal, but Bullseye is the same thing in this respect.
